24f0b847-9efa-41c5-9aec-f503b4ac9713.description: The course provides a foundation for using Flight Standards automated tools to perform oversight job tasks more effectively. 16674ff4-165c-4298-9f53-fa1ce03916dd.description: The course teaches basic ATC knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform in a level 5-9 ATC Tower Cab. Students receive laboratory instruction and practice in the Table Top, Tower 3D, and Tower Simulation System (TSS) laboratories. Students that successfully complete the course are placed in these facilities throughout the country in order to complete their training to become a Certified Professional Controller (CPC). Prerequisites: 50043, Air Traffic Basics, or direct entry qualifications.

Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 15 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

1f8e1614-0d34-4a50-bfb7-f5d52fdcea42.description: This course provides training for specialists on the DENRO (manufacturer) Enhanced Terminal Voice Switch (ETVS).
1f8e1614-0d34-4a50-bfb7-f5d52fdcea42.name: Enhanced Terminal Voice Switch (ETVS) Overview (FAA40066/FAA89605)(v.4)

issuer.summary: issued by Federal Aviation Administration Academy

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include performance rubrics/checklists, examinations and more with a minimum passing score of 70%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, practical exercises, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 4 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

f80f749c-332d-49b0-a35c-9e65752c8355.description: The course provides the knowledge, skills, and experience required for operation and maintenance of airfield high-intensity approach lighting systems. Topics include theory, operation, configuration, inspection, and performance checks; scheduled/required maintenance procedures, maintenance analysis/evaluation, and corrective maintenance procedures; fault isolation, troubleshooting, and repair; meters and test equipment; and control circuits.
f80f749c-332d-49b0-a35c-9e65752c8355.name: High Intensity Approach Lighting System (ALS) (44114)

issuer.summary: issued by Federal Aviation Administration Academy

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include performance rubrics, examination, and practical exercises with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include practical exercises and correspondence.

a0983ece-b69b-47fa-98d1-9ff3cde6a48e.description: The course is designed to provide training for Technical Operations System Specialists located at Remote Secondary Reliever Airport (SRA) ATCTs (Non-TDWR ATCTs) on the ITWS Remote Situation Display.
a0983ece-b69b-47fa-98d1-9ff3cde6a48e.name: ITWS Secondary Reliever Airport (SRA) (FAA-0828) (v.3)

issuer.summary: issued by Federal Aviation Administration Academy

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include audio visual materials, practical exercises, discussion, classroom exercises, laboratory, and lecture.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE CREDIT evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

127f1ded-693e-451b-94a7-9d896c006cbd.description: The course objective is to provide training for Technical Operations (TO) technicians capable of maintaining the Replacement Lamp Monitoring System (RLMS). Topics include 30/40/ 50KW constant current regulators; high voltage filtering; high voltage monitoring and protective equipment; shorting devices; interpreting schematics and wiring diagrams; troubleshooting high voltage systems to replaceable units; use of electrical and electronic test equipment; high voltage safety procedures.
127f1ded-693e-451b-94a7-9d896c006cbd.name: Replacement Lamp Monitoring System (RLMS) (41904)

issuer.summary: issued by Federal Aviation Administration Academy

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include performance rubrics and examination with a minimum passing score of 70 percent.
The methods of instruction include practical exercises, lecture, and classroom exercise.

99839898-3f0c-415d-8402-ae1c2e3b5957.description: The course is designed to provide training for technicians to maintain the TSM-2500 (Transmission System Monitor) program and creating new databases for adding new ATC Sites
99839898-3f0c-415d-8402-ae1c2e3b5957.name: TSM-2500 Monitoring and Control LDRCL RMMS System (42060) (v.4)
